description: This notification is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisDatabaseOverload.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'ISIS database overload state: Level 1: $v2' : (($v1==2) ? 'ISIS database overload state: Level 2: $v3' : 'ISIS database overload state: Level 1: $v2; Level 2: $v3')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisDatabaseOverload TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 ISIS-MIB::isisSysL1State i 1 ISIS-MIB::isisSysL2State i 1

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The state of the Level 1 database.
variables.name: ISIS-MIB::isisSysL1State

description: The state of the Level 2 database.
variables.name: ISIS-MIB::isisSysL2State

description: This notification is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisManualAddressDrops.

event.Summary: ISIS Manual address: $isisManAreaAddr dropped

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisManualAddressDrops ISIS-MIB::isisManAreaAddrExistState i 1

description: The state of the isisManAreaAddrEntry. This object
follows the Row Status behaviour. If an attempt is
made to set this object to the value destroy when the
corresponding isisManAreaAddrEntry is the only valid
entry for this instance and when the corresponding ISIS
instance has isisSysAdminState set to 'on' then the
attempt to delete the row is rejected.
variables.name: ISIS-MIB::isisManAreaAddrExistState

description: This notification is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisIDLenMismatch.

event.Summary: Received a PDU system ID length : $v1 mismatched

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisIDLenMismatch TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisFieldLen i 0 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisPDUFragment s EXAMPLE

description: Holds the System ID length reported in PDU we received.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisFieldLen

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: Holds up to the first 64 bytes of a PDU that triggered the
notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisPDUFragment

description: This notification is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisExportLimitReached.

event.Summary: Number of routes or prefixes exported into ISIS reached the max limit ($v2)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimitReached TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit u 9999

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The value of vRtrIsisExportLimit specifies the maximum number of
routes or prefixes that can be exported into ISIS from the route
table.
A value of 0 indicates that the export limit for routes or prefixes
has been disabled.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit

description: This notification is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisExportLimitWarning.

event.Summary: Number of routes or prefixes exported into ISIS is over $v3% of max limit ($v2)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimitWarning TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit u 9999 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimitLogPercent u 0

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The value of vRtrIsisExportLimit specifies the maximum number of
routes or prefixes that can be exported into ISIS from the route
table.
A value of 0 indicates that the export limit for routes or prefixes
has been disabled.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit

description: The value of vRtrIsisExportLimitLogPercent specifies the percentage of
the export-limit at which a warning log message and SNMP notification
would be sent. This would only be a warning and additional routes will
be learned up to 100% of vRtrIsisExportLimit.
A value of 0 indicates that vRtrIsisExportLimitLogPercent is disabled
and no log message or SNMP notification would be sent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimitLogPercent

tmnxIsisRoutesExpLmtDropped.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisRoutesExpLmtDropped TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit u 9999

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The value of vRtrIsisExportLimit specifies the maximum number of
routes or prefixes that can be exported into ISIS from the route
table.
A value of 0 indicates that the export limit for routes or prefixes
has been disabled.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisExportLimit

description: [CAUSE] A vRtrIsisSpbNbrMultAdjExists notification is sent when IS-IS
SPB instance detects a neighbor to which it already has a direct
adjacency on another interface.
[EFFECT] During SPF IS-IS SPB instance will have incorrect neighbor
information and hence path computations will be incorrect.
[RECOVERY] Check number of links to neighbor to make sure there is
only one link.

event.Summary: IS-IS SPB detected neighbor with multiple adjacency

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSpbNbrMultAdjExists TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisNbrSysId s EXAMPLE

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The value of vRtrIsisNbrSysId indicates the system-id of the neighbor
associated with the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisNbrSysId

description: [CAUSE] A vRtrIsisSpbNbrMultAdjExistsClear notification is sent when
an IS-IS SPB instance clears the condition raised by
vRtrIsisSpbNbrMultAdjExists notification.
[EFFECT] During SPF IS-IS SPB instance will have correct neighbor
information and hence path computations will be correct.
[RECOVERY] None required.

event.Summary: IS-IS neighbor with multiple adjacency alert cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSpbNbrMultAdjExistsClear TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisNbrSysId s EXAMPLE

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: Identifies the level the notification applies to.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisSystemLevel

description: The value of vRtrIsisNbrSysId indicates the system-id of the neighbor
associated with the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisNbrSysId

description: [CAUSE] A vRtrSpbEctFidCfgChg notification is sent when a
configuration change is made to vRtrSpbEctFidTable affecting
forwarding database identifiers in the range from vRtrSpbEctFidStart
to vRtrSpbEctFidEnd.
[EFFECT] There are changes in the vRtrSpbEctFidTable which may be
out-of-sync with management application.
[RECOVERY] Management application may need to synchronize with changes
in the vRtrSpbEctFidTable.

event.Summary: Configuration change in vRtrSpbEctFidTable affected forwarding database identifiers; Identifiers range: [$v1 $v2] ; Algorithm used: $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidCfgChg TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidStart i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidEnd i 1 TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidAlgorithm i 0

description: The value of vRtrSpbEctFidStart indicates the forwarding database
starting identifier associated with vRtrSpbEctFidCfgChg notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidStart

description: The value of vRtrSpbEctFidEnd indicates the forwarding database ending
identifier associated with vRtrSpbEctFidCfgChg notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidEnd

description: The value of vRtrSpbEctFidAlgorithm specifies the algorithm used by
the entry.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrSpbEctFidAlgorithm

description: [CAUSE] A vRtrIsisFailureDisabled notification is generated when ISIS
is operationally brought down. Reason for the failure is indicated by
vRtrIsisFailureReasonCode.
[EFFECT] ISIS is now operationally down.
[RECOVERY] ISIS will auto restart.

event.Summary: ISIS operational state: down; Reason: $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisFailureDisabled TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisFailureReasonCode i 1

description: The value of vRtrIsisFailureReasonCode indicates the reason for the
last ISIS failure which resulted in it being marked operationally
down.This object is used by the vRtrIsisFailureDisabled notification.
This object is obsoleted in release 12.0. It is replaced with
tmnxIsisFailureReasonCode.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ISIS-MIB::vRtrIsisFailureReasonCode
